descriptionSet.description: A page from a film brochure of the Hindi movie "Mahaan", released in 1983, shows the main actors, Amitabh Bachchan and Parveen Babi. The posters says that it is a cinemascope movie. The scene in the poster shows the protagonists dancing while holding aloft tambourine. Amitabh looks at the camera while Parveen looks upwards. Both protagonists wear western outfits. In the background is a big group of extras (dancers) dressed in Indian gypsy outfits dancing. Further back one could see flags and a crowd watching the dance.

inscription.text: Satya Chitra International presents Mahaan CinemaScope Produced by Satyanarayana - Suryanarayana Directed by S. Ramanathan Music B.D. Burman

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

description-en: A page from a film brochure of the Hindi movie "Mahaan", released in 1983, shows the main actors, Amitabh Bachchan and Parveen Babi. The posters says that it is a cinemascope movie. The scene in the poster shows the protagonists dancing while holding aloft tambourine. Amitabh looks at the camera while Parveen looks upwards. Both protagonists wear western outfits. In the background is a big group of extras (dancers) dressed in Indian gypsy outfits dancing. Further back one could see flags and a crowd watching the dance. (gs/sb/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie as on the website imdb: Vikram (Amjad Khan) is arrested for possession of drugs, but claims that he was framed by Rajan (Sujit Kumar), his associate, but no one believes him. Desperately he turns to his lawyer friend, Vikram, only to have himself prosecuted at his very hands. Vikram gets sentenced, and upon his release goes to Amit and asks him to negotiate to get him his share of their former business from Rajan. Amit agrees to do so, but the negotiation gets bitter, argument ensues, followed by fisticuffs and use of firearms, which lead to the death of Rajan. It is now Amit's turn to be on the run from the law, as his pleas that he acted in self-defense are ignored, and there is no one to turn to for help. Amit's pregnant wife, Janki, asks him to run away somewhere safe, while she re-locates to another city until his file is closed or set aside. Amit runs to nearby Nepal, while Janki gives birth to twins... (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0085886/, last accessed 2011-12-14, story line, leading actors, director. (gs)
